{"step_by_step_thinking": "Yes, increases in the cigarette tax rate can be linked to cigarette retail prices. When the tax rate on cigarettes is increased, it directly affects the cost of production and distribution for cigarette manufacturers. In order to maintain their profit margins, manufacturers often pass on the increased costs to retailers, who in turn pass on the costs to consumers by raising the retail prices of cigarettes. Therefore, there is a direct correlation between increases in the cigarette tax rate and cigarette retail prices.", "answer_choice": "A"}
